variables.name: TYPE_BITMAP
variables.comment:
* An icon that was created using {@link Icon#createWithBitmap(Bitmap)}.
     * @see #getType

variables.name: TYPE_RESOURCE
variables.comment:
* An icon that was created using {@link Icon#createWithResource}.
     * @see #getType

variables.name: TYPE_DATA
variables.comment:
* An icon that was created using {@link Icon#createWithData(byte[], int, int)}.
     * @see #getType

variables.name: TYPE_URI
TYPE_ADAPTIVE_BITMAP
variables.comment:
* An icon that was created using {@link Icon#createWithAdaptiveBitmap}.
     * @see #getType

variables.name: TYPE_URI_ADAPTIVE_BITMAP
variables.comment:
* An icon that was created using {@link Icon#createWithAdaptiveBitmapContentUri}.
     * @see #getType

variables.name: mUseMonochrome
variables.comment: TYPE_RESOURCE: use the monochrome drawable from an AdaptiveIconDrawable

variables.name: mInsetScale
variables.comment: TYPE_RESOURCE: wrap the monochrome drawable in an InsetDrawable with the specified inset

methods.name: public int getType()
methods.comment:
* Gets the type of the icon provided. *

* Note that new types may be added later, so callers should guard against other * types being returned.

methods.name: public Bitmap getBitmap()
methods.comment:
* @return The {@link android.graphics.Bitmap} held by this {@link #TYPE_BITMAP} or
     * {@link #TYPE_ADAPTIVE_BITMAP} Icon.
     *
     * Note that this will always return an immutable Bitmap.
     * @hide

methods.name: private void setBitmap(Bitmap b)
methods.comment:
* Sets the Icon's contents to a particular Bitmap. Note that this may make a copy of the Bitmap
     * if the supplied Bitmap is mutable. In that case, the value returned by getBitmap() may not
     * equal the Bitmap passed to setBitmap().
     *
     * @hide

methods.name: public int getDataLength()
methods.comment:
* @return The length of the compressed bitmap byte array held by this {@link #TYPE_DATA} Icon.
     * @hide

methods.name: public int getDataOffset()
methods.comment:
* @return The offset into the byte array held by this {@link #TYPE_DATA} Icon at which
     * valid compressed bitmap data is found.
     * @hide

methods.name: public byte[] getDataBytes()
methods.comment:
* @return The byte array held by this {@link #TYPE_DATA} Icon ctonaining compressed
     * bitmap data.
     * @hide

methods.name: public Resources getResources()
methods.comment:
* @return The {@link android.content.res.Resources} for this {@link #TYPE_RESOURCE} Icon.
     * @hide

methods.name: public String getResPackage()
methods.comment:
* Gets the package used to create this icon. *

* Only valid for icons of type {@link #TYPE_RESOURCE}. * Note: This package may not be available if referenced in the future, and it is * up to the caller to ensure safety if this package is re-used and/or persisted.

methods.name: public int getResId()
methods.comment:
* Gets the resource used to create this icon. *

* Only valid for icons of type {@link #TYPE_RESOURCE}. * Note: This resource may not be available if the application changes at all, and it is * up to the caller to ensure safety if this resource is re-used and/or persisted.

methods.name: public String getUriString()
public Uri getUri()
methods.comment:
* Gets the uri used to create this icon. *

* Only valid for icons of type {@link #TYPE_URI} and {@link #TYPE_URI_ADAPTIVE_BITMAP}. * Note: This uri may not be available in the future, and it is * up to the caller to ensure safety if this uri is re-used and/or persisted.

methods.name: private static final String typeToString(int x)
public void loadDrawableAsync(@NonNull Context context, @NonNull Message andThen)
public void loadDrawableAsync(@NonNull Context context, final OnDrawableLoadedListener listener, Handler handler)
public Drawable loadDrawable(Context context)
methods.comment:
* Returns a Drawable that can be used to draw the image inside this Icon, constructing it
     * if necessary. Depending on the type of image, this may not be something you want to do on
     * the UI thread, so consider using
     * {@link #loadDrawableAsync(Context, Message) loadDrawableAsync} instead.
     *
     * @param context {@link android.content.Context Context} in which to load the drawable; used
     *                to access {@link android.content.res.Resources Resources}, for example.
     * @return A fresh instance of a drawable for this image, yours to keep.

methods.name: private static Drawable crateMonochromeDrawable(Drawable drawable, float inset)
methods.comment:
* Gets the monochrome drawable from an {@link AdaptiveIconDrawable}.
     *
     * @param drawable An {@link AdaptiveIconDrawable}
     * @return Adjusted (wrapped in {@link InsetDrawable}) monochrome drawable
     *  from an {@link AdaptiveIconDrawable}.
     * Or the original drawable if no monochrome layer exists.

methods.name: private Bitmap fixMaxBitmapSize(Bitmap bitmap)
private Drawable fixMaxBitmapSize(Resources res, Drawable drawable)
private Drawable loadDrawableInner(Context context)
methods.comment: * Do the heavy lifting of loading the drawable, but stop short of applying any tint.

methods.name: public Drawable loadDrawableAsUser(Context context, int userId)
methods.comment:
* Load the requested resources under the given userId, if the system allows it,
     * before actually loading the drawable.
     *
     * @hide

methods.name: public Drawable loadDrawableCheckingUriGrant(Context context, IUriGrantsManager iugm, int callingUid, String packageName)
methods.comment:
* Load a drawable, but in the case of URI types, it will check if the passed uid has a grant * to load the resource. The check will be performed using the permissions of the passed uid, * and not those of the caller. *

* This should be called for {@link Icon} objects that come from a not trusted source and may * contain a URI. * * After the check, if passed, {@link #loadDrawable} will be called. If failed, this will * return {@code null}. * * @see #loadDrawable * * @hide

methods.name: public void convertToAshmem()
methods.comment:
* Puts the memory used by this instance into Ashmem memory, if possible.
     * @hide

methods.name: public void writeToStream(@NonNull OutputStream stream) throws IOException
methods.comment:
* Writes a serialized version of an Icon to the specified stream.
     *
     * @param stream The stream on which to serialize the Icon.
     * @hide

methods.name: public static Icon createFromStream(@NonNull InputStream stream) throws IOException
methods.comment:
* Create an Icon from the specified stream.
     *
     * @param stream The input stream from which to reconstruct the Icon.
     * @hide

methods.name: public boolean sameAs(@NonNull Icon otherIcon)
methods.comment:
* Compares if this icon is constructed from the same resources as another icon.
     * Note that this is an inexpensive operation and doesn't do deep Bitmap equality comparisons.
     *
     * @param otherIcon the other icon
     * @return whether this icon is the same as the another one
     * @hide

methods.name: public static Icon createWithResource(Context context, @DrawableRes int resId)
methods.comment:
* Create an Icon pointing to a drawable resource.
     * @param context The context for the application whose resources should be used to resolve the
     *                given resource ID.
     * @param resId ID of the drawable resource

methods.name: public static Icon createWithResource(Resources res, @DrawableRes int resId)
methods.comment:
* Version of createWithResource that takes Resources. Do not use.
     * @hide

methods.name: public static Icon createWithResource(String resPackage, @DrawableRes int resId)
methods.comment:
* Create an Icon pointing to a drawable resource.
     * @param resPackage Name of the package containing the resource in question
     * @param resId ID of the drawable resource

methods.name: public static Icon createWithResourceAdaptiveDrawable(@NonNull String resPackage, @DrawableRes int resId, boolean useMonochrome, float inset)
methods.comment:
* Create an Icon pointing to a drawable resource.
     * @param resPackage Name of the package containing the resource in question
     * @param resId ID of the drawable resource
     * @param useMonochrome if this icon should use the monochrome res from the adaptive drawable
     * @hide

methods.name: public static Icon createWithBitmap(Bitmap bits)
methods.comment:
* Create an Icon pointing to a bitmap in memory.
     * @param bits A valid {@link android.graphics.Bitmap} object

methods.name: public static Icon createWithAdaptiveBitmap(Bitmap bits)
methods.comment:
* Create an Icon pointing to a bitmap in memory that follows the icon design guideline defined
     * by {@link AdaptiveIconDrawable}.
     * @param bits A valid {@link android.graphics.Bitmap} object

methods.name: public static Icon createWithData(byte[] data, int offset, int length)
methods.comment: * Create an Icon pointing to a compressed bitmap stored in a byte array. * @param data Byte array storing compressed bitmap data of a type that * {@link android.graphics.BitmapFactory} * can decode (see {@link android.graphics.Bitmap.CompressFormat}). * @param offset Offset into data at which the bitmap data starts * @param length Length of the bitmap data

methods.name: public static Icon createWithContentUri(String uri)
methods.comment:
* Create an Icon pointing to an image file specified by URI.
     *
     * @param uri A uri referring to local content:// or file:// image data.

methods.name: public static Icon createWithContentUri(Uri uri)
methods.comment:
* Create an Icon pointing to an image file specified by URI.
     *
     * @param uri A uri referring to local content:// or file:// image data.

methods.name: public static Icon createWithAdaptiveBitmapContentUri(@NonNull String uri)
methods.comment:
* Create an Icon pointing to an image file specified by URI. Image file should follow the icon
     * design guideline defined by {@link AdaptiveIconDrawable}.
     *
     * @param uri A uri referring to local content:// or file:// image data.

methods.name: public static Icon createWithAdaptiveBitmapContentUri(@NonNull Uri uri)
methods.comment:
* Create an Icon pointing to an image file specified by URI. Image file should follow the icon
     * design guideline defined by {@link AdaptiveIconDrawable}.
     *
     * @param uri A uri referring to local content:// or file:// image data.

methods.name: public Icon setTint(@ColorInt int tint)
methods.comment:
* Store a color to use whenever this Icon is drawn.
     *
     * @param tint a color, as in {@link Drawable#setTint(int)}
     * @return this same object, for use in chained construction

methods.name: public Icon setTintList(ColorStateList tintList)
methods.comment:
* Store a color to use whenever this Icon is drawn.
     *
     * @param tintList as in {@link Drawable#setTintList(ColorStateList)}, null to remove tint
     * @return this same object, for use in chained construction

methods.name: public ColorStateList getTintList()
methods.comment: @hide

methods.name: public Icon setTintMode(@NonNull PorterDuff.Mode mode)
methods.comment:
* Store a blending mode to use whenever this Icon is drawn.
     *
     * @param mode a blending mode, as in {@link Drawable#setTintMode(PorterDuff.Mode)}, may be null
     * @return this same object, for use in chained construction

methods.name: public Icon setTintBlendMode(@NonNull BlendMode mode)
methods.comment:
* Store a blending mode to use whenever this Icon is drawn.
     *
     * @param mode a blending mode, as in {@link Drawable#setTintMode(PorterDuff.Mode)}, may be null
     * @return this same object, for use in chained construction

methods.name: public BlendMode getTintBlendMode()
methods.comment: @hide

methods.name: public boolean hasTint()
methods.comment: @hide

methods.name: public static Icon createWithFilePath(String path)
methods.comment:
* Create an Icon pointing to an image file specified by path.
     *
     * @param path A path to a file that contains compressed bitmap data of
     *           a type that {@link android.graphics.BitmapFactory} can decode.

methods.name: public int describeContents()
methods.comment: * Parcelable interface

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int flags)
public static Bitmap scaleDownIfNecessary(Bitmap bitmap, int maxWidth, int maxHeight)
methods.comment:
* Scale down a bitmap to a given max width and max height. The scaling will be done in a uniform way
     * @param bitmap the bitmap to scale down
     * @param maxWidth the maximum width allowed
     * @param maxHeight the maximum height allowed
     *
     * @return the scaled bitmap if necessary or the original bitmap if no scaling was needed
     * @hide

methods.name: public void scaleDownIfNecessary(int maxWidth, int maxHeight)
methods.comment:
* Scale down this icon to a given max width and max height.
     * The scaling will be done in a uniform way and currently only bitmaps are supported.
     * @param maxWidth the maximum width allowed
     * @param maxHeight the maximum height allowed
     *
     * @hide
